'''Mienfoo''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''コジョフー''' ''Kojofu'') is a {{type|Fighting}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Mienshao}} starting at [[level]] 50.

==Biology==
Mienfoo is a yellow, bipedal, mustelid-like Pokémon, with round ears, red eyes, and a pink nose with a whisker on each side. Its red arms look similar to flared sleeves, and the paws are yellow. Mienfoo’s chest has a small red band, and its pelt piles around its thighs resembling a tunic or robe. Its legs are red, and its yellow tail is also tipped red.

Mienfoo specializes in flowing, speedy, continuous attacks, becoming more precise as it concentrates. Though not very powerful, it can make this up with quantity. It also has sharp claws it can use to cut foes. Packs of Mienfoo seclude themselves to mountains to focus on their training. Each pack differs in their kick and chop form.

==In the anime==
[[File:Korrina Mienfoo.png|thumb|left|250px|Mienfoo in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Mienfoo debuted in ''[[BW046|The Beartic Mountain Feud!]]'', under the ownership of [[Cliff]]. Cliff uses Mienfoo to assist him as a mountain guard.

A Mienfoo appeared in ''[[XY044|Showdown at the Shalour Gym!]]'', under the ownership of [[Korrina]]. Korrina used Mienfoo in her battle against {{Ash}}; it battled against {{AP|Hawlucha}} and was soon defeated.

===Minor appearances===
A Mienfoo appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW070|The Clubsplosion Begins!]]''.

A Mienfoo made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW083|Rocking at the Virbank Gym! Part 1]]''.

Two Mienfoo appeared in a flashback or a fantasy in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Lysandre Mienfoo Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Mienfoo in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Mienfoo appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon kidnapped by Team Plasma. It was later found in a stronghold and returned to its trainer.

A Mienfoo appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

A Mienfoo appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS510|A Wretched Reunion]]''.

[[Lysandre]] owns a Mienfoo which first appeared in ''[[PAXY09|Chespin Sows the Seeds of Change]]''.

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Mienfoo appears to be based on combination of a {{wp|Mustelidae|mustelid}} and a user of {{wp|kung fu}} or a Japanese evil spirit {{wp|kamaitachi}}.

====Name origin====
Mienfoo may be a combination of ''{{wp|Stoat|ermine}}'' and ''{{wp|kung fu}}''.

Kojofu is a combination of オコジョ ''okojo'' (ermine) and ''kung fu''.
